intro: Pseudognaphalium nataliae, commonly known as Natal's false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Pseudognaphalium nataliae is well adapted to drought conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh climates.
